H0.text: Give a year in the reign of King Richard I of England (The Lionheart). 1190

H1.text: Give a year in the reign of King Richard I of England (The Lionheart). 1195

H2.text: Give a year in the reign of King Richard I of England (The Lionheart). 1188

H3.text: Give a year in the reign of King Richard I of England (The Lionheart). 1189-99

A4.text: Richard I reigned from 1189 until his death in 1199.

A5.text: During his ten years' reign, Richard was in England for no more than six months, and totally absent for the last five years.

A6.text: 6 July – Henry II dies at the Château de Chinon; Richard becomes king.

A7.text: 1189 is the year Henry II died and Richard I became king.

A8.text: 12 March–28 March – Richard returns to England and besieges Nottingham Castle to reclaim it from his brother John.

A9.text: 1195 Treaty of Louviers suspends war between England and France; France takes control of Norman Vexin.

A10.text: 19 November – Baldwin of Exeter, Archbishop of Canterbury

A11.text: 6 April – Richard I of England was killed in battle

A12.text: 17 April – second coronation of Richard I at Winchester.

A13.text: 2 May – Portsmouth granted a Royal Charter; dock ordered to be built here.

A15.text: Hugh de Puiset, bishop of Durham (born c. 1125)

A16.text: 1188 Henry II imposes the Saladin tithe to pay for the planned crusade.
